author: dims
msg: Proposed Contribution to Apache - WSIF from Paul Fremantle, WebServices Architect, IBM Hursley (pzf@hursley.ibm.com)
Here's the attached note from Paul:

IBM has developed a codebase called WSIF (WebServices Invocation Framework) which has been available on alphaWorks for some time now (www.alphaworks.ibm.com/tech/wsif). WSIF provides two main things: an SPI or pluggable provider model that matches the extensibility of WSDL - so if new ports and bindings are developed, WSIF allows existing clients to access services without changes to the code. Also WSIF supports a Dynamic Invocation Interface (DII) that is very closely modelled on WSDL, which is useful in building dynamic tools, such as flow engines. We have done a considerable amount of work on WSIF since the alphaWorks release, and we would like to propose contributing this to Apache. We are interested in your feedback on this proposal - including where it should be posted, proposed package names, and how we could work to use this in an Apache WebServices context. I have attached a couple of files - the source code and a brief overview of WSIF. There are also two good articles on WSIF on developerWorks
(please note the APIs have changed since those articles were published).
Paul Fremantle, WebServices Architect, IBM Hursley
